text.p: Bonds (OT) firmed with other periphery European markets and dealers said that the shorter end had most potential for gain while the longer bonds would struggle to bring the yield spread against Bunds below its current 83 basis points (bp) level.
"We're waiting for the Bank of Spain. A cut in the Spanish repo will boost the non-resident demand for shorter OT tomorrow", one trader said.
"The prices of the 10-year cash, whose spread (vs Bund) is near all-time lows, have no upside potential. The greatest potential is at the shorter end of the curve", another said.
"A cut in the Spanish repo would encourage the Bank of Portugal (BP) to do the same, in the short-term", the trader added.
"With a cut of the Spanish repo, the curve would steepen more and the spread between the two- and 10-year bonds would widen five to 10 basis points," added another trader.
The spread between the March 1999 OT and the February 2007 OT was at 104 bps against 108 bps at the opening.
